(verb) to leave a place, thing, or perso: (adv) in a way that is harmful o likely to cause problems
(noun) something formed by adding together several amounts or things
(verb) to prepare land and grow crops on it, or to grow a particular crop
(verb) to spread a natural or chemical substance on land or plants, in order to make the grow well
(verb) to become greater, more serious, or more extreme, or to make something do this
(noun) the practice of supplying land with water so that crops and plants will grow
(verb) to get something, especially by asking for it, buying it, working for it or producing it from something else
(noun) the process by which a plan uses the energy from the light of the sun to produce its own food
(noun) water that falls from the clouds towards the ground, especially as rain or snow
